description:
This is a market on whether there will be 7 consecutive days before June 1, 2022 with more than 2 million people traveling through a TSA checkpoint on each of the days. 

The resolution source for this market will be the daily checkpoint throughput as measured by the US Transportation Security Administration (TSA), https://www.tsa.gov/coronavirus/passenger-throughput. Should this URL change or move locations a new URL on the tsa.gov domain will remain valid to resolve this market. 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the TSA reports a daily checkpoint throughput of more than 2,000,000 for seven days in a row within the market timeframe and "No" otherwise.

The market timeframe spans from March 29 2022 to May 31 2022, with the earliest day to start counting the streak being March 29, and the latest being May 25, 2022.


This market will resolve as soon as throughput data becomes available for the date of May 31, 2022, or on any date before that if the target is reached. If the data is not available for any of the days from March 19, 2022, to May 31, 2022, by June 2, 2022, the throughput of those days will be counted as below 2,000,000. Any revisions published to data for dates March 29, 2022 and onward prior to the release of data for May 31, 2022, will be considered.

markets.question: Will more than 2 million people travel through a TSA checkpoint on 7 consecutive days before June 1, 2022?

title: Will more than 2 million people travel through a TSA checkpoint on 7 consecutive days before June 1, 2022?
